paper_abstract: Let G be a simple graph. For nu is an element of V(G), k-degree d(k)(nu) of v is the number of walks of length k of G starting at v. In this paper a lower bounds of the spectral radius of G in terms of the k-degree of vertices is presented and the upper bounds of energy of a connected graph is obtained.
paper_title: On the spectral radius, k-degree and the upper bound of energy in a graph
